issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Fix bug in creating services through services REST API in RM

comments.body: Fixed Jaxb provider and bootstrap bug.

a minor comment, we may use "YarnJacksonJaxbJsonProvider.class.getName()" for the class name ?

We don't need reflection to load YarnJacksonJaxbJsonProvider, since it is already available with the hadoop-yarn-common dependency. I am not sure if using this provider will change the behavior of other RMWebApp endpoints.

- Removed reflection from the patch.
- Ran unit tests manually, and I did not find any test failure introduced by this patch.  There are many serialization unit tests for resource manager webapp.  None of them showed regression.  I think this provided some confidence that this patch did not regress other REST endpoint entities.

Revise the patch to handle classpath issue only.  The second discovered problem regarding context resolver will be handled in YARN-7218.
I agree separating this into two tickets is a good idea. +1 for patch 003 for the service.libdir fix.
